creator: eison@arsdigita.com
text:
Asking for the real path of a filename that includes ".." (i.e. "..test")
returns null.  This is a valid filename and directory name (at least on Sun
Solaris) and should be allowed.

This fails due to the final "security" check in FileUtil.java's safePath method,
which returns null if it finds ".." anywhere in the path.  This is an
inappropriate check; it should be allowed in the filename or directory name.

Please modify this check (line 222 of FileUtil.java).

creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
text: Won't be fixed in 3.2.2, but will be considered for a later release.
This is an area that resulted in many security problems, and fixing it is too risky. It is unfortunate, but I don't think we should fix this bug.
